studyAmendmentImpacts.description: Provided study visit scheduling flexibility by allowing optional phone visits at specific weeks.
Added exploratory endpoint for non-severe hypoglycemic events in responders.
Updated guidance on DKA assessments, insulin dose reductions, and ketone monitoring.
Modified primary efficacy endpoint analysis methods and multiplicity procedures.
Removed requirement regarding HbA1c stability during lead-in phase.

studyAmendmentReasons.reasonText: Provide study visit scheduling flexibility for subjects during the 24-week treatment period.
Enhance safety monitoring and risk mitigation for Diabetic Ketoacidosis (DKA).
Regulatory authority feedback from the European Medicines Agency (EMA).

studyChanges.beforeText: Central laboratory HbA1c [previous value not specified]
studyChanges.summary: Revised the upper range of the Week -1 Visit HbA1c.

studyChanges.afterText: Reductions in insulin doses of more than 20% are not recommended regardless of glucose values.
studyChanges.summary: Added specific restriction on insulin dose reduction to mitigate DKA risk.
Updated multiplicity adjustment procedure for improved power.

studyChanges.afterText: Tubal Ligation in this protocol is not considered surgical sterilization
studyChanges.summary: Clarified definition of surgical sterilization for women of childbearing potential.

studyChanges.beforeText: Requirement that HbA1c may not drop more than 0.5% during the lead-in phase
studyChanges.summary: Removed HbA1c stability requirement based on EMA feedback.
